meanings.definition: To undo or remove stitches from fabric.
meanings.sent1: She carefully unstitched the hem of her dress to make it shorter.
meanings.sent2: The tailor had to unstitch the seams of the jacket to make alterations.
meanings.sent3: As a prank, he secretly unstitched the buttons on her shirt.
meanings.sent4: The bond between them seemed to slowly unstitch over time.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved magically unstitching a handkerchief.

meanings.definition: To unravel or separate threads that have been sewn together.
meanings.sent1: The cat managed to unstitch the entire quilt with its sharp claws.
meanings.sent2: It took hours to carefully unstitch the tangled threads of the embroidery.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to unstitch the puppet's strings during the play.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to unstitch the delicate fabric of their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to unstitch the lies to reveal the truth.
